content.title: Post Doctoral Fellowship to Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe Candidates
content.details: This scheme has been initiated keeping in view the social background of the candidates from the deprived section of society and to provide them an opportunity to undertake advanced studies and research in Science, Engineering & Technology, Humanities and Social Sciences in Indian Universities/Institutions/Colleges.
benefits: Fellowship amount of ₹38,800/- per month for first 2 years & ₹46,500/- per month from third year onwards.
Annual contingency of ₹50,000/- for five years.
Escorts/Reader assistance of ₹2,000/- per month for physically disabled & blind candidates.
House Rent Allowance as per University/Institution rules.
eligibility: The candidate must have a doctorate degree in the relevant subject preferably with published research work.
Candidates should belong to the Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe category.
Only Ph.D. awarded unemployed candidates are eligible.
Upper age limit is 50 years for male applicants and 55 years for female candidates.
Candidates of SC/ST categories must have 50% marks at UG level and 55% marks at PG level.
content.application_process: Online application process through advertisements in leading newspapers and Employment News once a year.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To provide an opportunity to SC/ST candidates to undertake postdoctoral research in Sciences, Engineering & Technology, Humanities and Social Sciences.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing agency of this scheme?
faqs.answer: University Grants Commission, Government of India.

faqs.question: How much amount of fellowship is paid under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The fellowship under the scheme is ₹38,800/- per month for the first 2 years & ₹46,500/- per month from the third year onwards.

faqs.question: What is the duration of the fellowship?
faqs.answer: The tenure of the fellowship is five years with no provision for further extension.

faqs.question: Can a Transgender candidate apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, Transgender candidates are eligible to apply under the scheme.
